intro: Lepisanthes divaricata f. divaricata, commonly known as the variegated orchid, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, colorful inflorescences. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a waxy texture and produces fragrant, showy flowers in shades of white, yellow, and pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil for optimal growth. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for tropical gardens and indoor cultivation.
